intro: Ampelosicyos major, commonly known as the giant desert cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, sprawling stems that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers during the warmer months, which are followed by small, red fruits. Its thick, fleshy stems are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant's structure and growth habits make it a unique example of desert flora adaptation.
